required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 1 Study of the CD73 Inhibitor(HLX23) Alone in Participants With Solid Tumor
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Clinical Study to Investigate the Safety, Tolerability and to Determine the Maximum Tolerated Dose and Recommended Phase 2 Dose of HLX23 (CD73 Inhibitor) in Patients With Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: The reason for this study is to see if the CD73 inhibitor HLX23 alone is safe and effective in participants with advanced solid cancer.

detailed_description.textblock: An open-label, dose escalation, first-in-human, phase 1 clinical study to investigate the safety, tolerability and to determine the maximum tolerated dose and recommended phase 2 dose of HLX23 (recombinant anti-CD73 humanized monoclonal antibody) in patients with advanced or metastatic solid tumors

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Dose Limiting Toxicity

secondary_outcome.description: To measure the serum concentration of HLX23
Percentage of CD73 receptor occupancy on circulating

secondary_outcome.time_frame: predose at cycle 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 16, 24, 36, 48 and subsequently every 12 cycles.(each cycle is 1 week)
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of anti-HLX23 antibody (ADA) positive results

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through Disease Progression or Death (Estimated at up to 2 Years)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of Participants with Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through Measured Progressive Disease (Estimated at up to 2 Years)
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of Participants with a Best Overall Response of CR, PR, and Stable Disease
